H0.text: Deltas are landforms that can be caused by reverse faults, which occur when one side of a fault plane is driven up over the other side.

H1.text: Mountains are landforms that can be caused by reverse faults, in which one side of a fault plane is driven up over the other side.

H2.text: Dunes are landforms that can be caused by reverse faults, which occur when one side of a fault plane is driven up over the other side.

H3.text: Islands are landforms that can be created by a reverse fault, in which one side of a fault plane is driven up over the other side.

A4.text: Reverse faults indicate compressive shortening of the crust.

A5.text: In a reverse fault, the hanging wall displaces upward, while in a normal fault the hanging wall displaces downward.
